revised_title: Electrostatic Charge from Walking on Carpets
tldr: The author, Charles Wheatstone, discovered that walking on carpets can generate an electrostatic charge in the body. This charge can be detected using an electrometer or a galvanometer. The effect is more noticeable when wearing shoes with thin, polished soles and when the room is dry. This phenomenon can interfere with electrical experiments and should be considered when conducting research in such environments.
